newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss franc ends year quietly mixed.
newsitem.headline: Swiss franc ends year quietly mixed.

text.p: 1300 GMT - The Swiss franc ended 1996 on a quiet note after dipping to the lowest levels in over two years against the dollar on Monday, with range trade the order of the day.
The dollar hovered below 1.35 Swiss francs during much of the abbreviated session, below Monday's high of 1.3536. Tuesday's high was 1.3515.
The mark continued its assault on three-year highs against the franc, ending up slightly from Monday's close. But it too held in a narrow range, staying below the 87.00-centime level.
Activity was static before New Year's. Banks will be closed Wednesday for New Year's and banks in Zurich remain closed on Thursday. On Tuesday, trading rooms closed at 1300 GMT.

In Swiss bond markets some traders speculated that a dollar correction was on its way, citing that as a factor boosting prices of short-term Swiss debt paper. But some currency traders were more apt to predict a continuation of the trend towards a stronger dollar. *Dollar ends at 1.3466/3471 Swiss francs versus 1.3505/3515. *Mark ends at 86.86/89 centimes versus 86.79/82 on Monday.
